website_summaries.verdict: Its 4-in-1 capabilities make it the best deal available by far – it's a potty chair with a training seat for home and travel and a step stool all in one model.
pros: Offers a complete potty training system
Potty chair has rugged construction and the removable seat is soft and comfortable
cons: It has a lot of components which make it a bit challenging to clean
but considering its versatility, you might not mind

customer_reviews.title: Nice, wish a couple things were different
customer_reviews.text: Works for what it's intended. Two things I'm not keen on. One, the top slides around pretty bad on our toilet seat when we try to set our daughter on it. We have an oblong seat and there just doesn't seem to be a good way of setting the potty seat on it just right. Two, and maybe it's a girl thing, the little splash guard in the front could stand to be a little higher. Any slight lean back from our little girl and you end up wearing it. Especially if it's more than just a trickle. Otherwise, it's easy to clean and I like the step stool aspect of it.
customer_reviews.author: E.M.

customer_reviews.title: Too many crevices.
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this potty for about a year. It's an ok product. It's just more hassle than it's worth. Too many pieces and crevices to clean, I've found. I initially thought the versatility of this product would be worth the price, but the cleanup is more trouble than it's worth. In hindsight I should have gotten a far more simple potty/design that was easier to clean and half the price. Save your money and go for something more simple.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing. Feels super solid
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. Feels super solid. We tried several different other ones and this one was the largest seat. Our kid is special needs 4 year old, so it was very important that he had a stable and large seat since his core strength isn't strong. The seat itself is solid and the pee pee protector is not too high that you can still see if he's gone. We bought two, one for home and one for the car.
customer_reviews.author: CleanDean

customer_reviews.title: A Beautiful Product
customer_reviews.text: Granny here getting ready to train my granddaughter. This toilet is a winner! It's very well made and looks very comfortable for gd. I went ahead and put a four gallon trash bag over the "collection " area and I am ready to roll. The Primo Toilet Trainer came quickly in a plain brown box and was already assembled. The step stool feature will be very handy while washing hands . The transition to the regular toilet is greatly assisted by the step stool feature as well! I am very happy with this product and anticipate much usefulness while traveling too because of the lid.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Thiesen

customer_reviews.title: Quality made product with children in mind
customer_reviews.text: Such a great product! I'm a sucker for anything that has multiple uses. Right now, my 20 month old likes to use this as a "bookshelf" while she washes her hands after going pretend potty. :) PROS Love having the ability to use this as a stand alone potty, or just move the seat over the big toilet. Super portable for those on-the-go mishaps, or visits to grandma and grandpa's house. Seat is cushy, however firm enough to support child. Removable seat has handles for extra security for child. Has lid to teach children to PLEASE put the lid down, and also keeps things clean and tidy when company is over. CONS Honestly none that I can think of.
customer_reviews.author: MrsW

customer_reviews.title: Nice potty for non-average baby
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea how manufacturers design and test potties, but most of them absolutely uncomfortable, especially if your LO is bigger that average kids. This potty best for us. Extra space around, soft top (It is rubber. Not very soft, but much better that plastic.), lid.
customer_reviews.author: VVK

customer_reviews.title: Working good
customer_reviews.text: Going through the potty training in earnest and it has been a pretty good training seat. Great to close it and use it so the kiddo can reach the sink and wash hands. Haven't used it as a small seat on a standard yet but seems like it'll work for us when the time comes. The biggest part of the seat is a little hard to clean if it gets in there because sometimes, somehow, it gets in the most amazing places through some sort of space-time distortion, but on the "good" potties it is a piece of cake to wipe off the seat or clean out the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy construction
customer_reviews.text: I was not impressed by the construction of this potty. The base is open, which made it much less stable. The whole thing was much less sturdy than I expected, and when my son sat on it it visbly shifted. Also, I bought this for the "soft seat". The seat is not rubbery, it is a very soft and moldable plastic that fives completely under the smallest anount of pressure. This left my son sitting on a flat, unmolded ring of hard plastic. We replaced it with a contours 3 in 1 potty that we are very happy with, despite it being quit a bit more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Sian C.

customer_reviews.title: Our two year old loves her potty!
customer_reviews.text: Our two year old loves her potty. Soft seat, perfect height and we LOVE the handles! Our daughter is just beginning potty training and she enjoys sitting on the potty for fun. She can get on and off by herself. Easy to clean and easy to put together after cleaning. I recommend using a coffee filter for ease in cleaning up poops! We searched many stores and read many reviews before selecting this potty. We are very happy with the purchase. We have zero complaints and highly recommend this children's potty!
customer_reviews.author: emmab

customer_reviews.title: Useless pee guard
customer_reviews.text: Not for boys. The pee guard is useless. I'm not a fan of cleaning up pee on the floor and when he is pushing with #2, cleaning up pee that gets shot across the room - hitting his little sister whos just crawling around, minding her own business.. If the mopping and bathing wasn't enough, the potty itself is ridiculous to clean. There's just too many pieces, crevices and grooves to clean. Then lining up and snapping the many peices back in place.... I can't. I just can't.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Most sturdy, long lasting, comfortable sir down potty
customer_reviews.text: We keep one of these in the minivan, one in the bathroom and in the living room. This is the most sturdy and useful potty out of all we own. We also have 3 different baby Bjorn's, a summer infant potty, toppers, and a Fisher Price one. This one the child can use themselves, whereas the others have too small of a container, too hard of a seat, or s bowl that sticks to child's bottom and has to be held down when they stand. Also, I (180 lbs) have sat on it when I needed a stool to sit on.
customer_reviews.author: Milica M.

customer_reviews.title: THE potty that convinced our daughter to start potty training!
customer_reviews.text: We use it in our daughter's room (as you can close it when not in use). It is very comfortable and she likes the handles. It is sturdy and will probably be used for a long time. The only problem is that the colored seat tends to retain stains a little bit (in my experience it works best with cold water and simple soap).
customer_reviews.author: Laure

customer_reviews.title: my 1.5 years old loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My toddler loves it and uses it right away on the big potty! We just used the potty seat and the step stool as that's the purpose of getting this one. He loves the independence he could get from getting up to the potty almost all by himself (with a little help as he is still young). We also use the step stool to get onto his taller step stool to reach the sink and his highchair. He absolutely loves such freedom and practices getting up and down many times since we got it a day ago!
customer_reviews.author: Adieux

customer_reviews.title: The potty trainer look's nice, but doesn't fit the needs of my 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: The potty trainer look's nice, but doesn't fit the needs of my 2 years old. He weighs 38lb and height 36in. The trainer toilet is hard plastic but you have to be careful when putting on the floor, it can slip if the the child use it as a step stool. Better if you use a rug under the stool. The toilet seat is soft and easy to take with you, the handles make it easy for the child to sit. The toilet pee guard is to small to catch anything. My boy didnt pee in it, but if he would have, im positive pee would be every where. I return the potty.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla

customer_reviews.title: Good size, overall a nice potty.
customer_reviews.text: Overall it's fine. I can see a few areas where improvement can be applied. The soft seat is detachable and has slots that fit into the frame and come loose very easily. It should be molded into the removable frame..several places where the edges need to be smoothed over. The size is the best thing about it. Will be big enough for him to use until he graduates to the big potty.
customer_reviews.author: Carol V

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Grandkids regard this as a very grown up potty. NO tinker bells, or whistles.... so we can live with it too. Works well as a step stool with the lid closed. Soft, comfortable seat. Non imposing. Excellent design and quality.
customer_reviews.author: The King family

customer_reviews.title: Best potty
customer_reviews.text: This is our at- hone potty. Bad thing...sometimes the blue seat stains. Otherwise, great product. Easy to empty and wipe down. We’ve used it as a step stool too which worked well. The lip in front is just enough for our boy to not make a mess when he pees.
customer_reviews.author: BrittanyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: So versatile!
customer_reviews.text: I’m all about products that have more than 1 function and this potty does not disappoint! My daughter seems comfortable on it and I love that the seat can be taken off to place on the toilet. She especially loves using it that way, because she enjoys flushing. When we aren’t using it as a potty, it makes for a great step-stool to help her reach the sink and makes her feel so independent! I would recommend purchasing the liners as well.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Lots of options, but messy and breakable.
customer_reviews.text: This toilet starter out as just okay... I bought it for the various options, not knowing how our toilet-training days would come along. Before we started toilet training, my kid was drawn to this one because it looked similar to a real toilet. However, as the months have gone by, it has proven somewhat non-durable (the handles broke) and difficult to clean (boy pee seems to collect everywhere, and there are just always different parts to clean. Our other training toilet (a Baby Bjorn) is simpler, smaller, and more streamlined - therefore easier to clean and not break. He definitely prefers to sit on that one, too.
customer_reviews.author: Shortkick

customer_reviews.title: This thing works great as a stepstool
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great as a stepstool. There are many, many crevices for germs to get trapped, making it an absolute nightmare to keep clean. My son liked to dump out the contents into the big toilet when he was done, and would get frustrated over how difficult it was to remove the seat. However, this trainer is sturdy and seems comfortable for little ones. The handles help them keep their balance. This isn't my favorite potty, but it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Amy H.

customer_reviews.title: Good but not a sturdy step stool
customer_reviews.text: My son outgrew this pretty quickly but it worked well while he could use it. The base is NOT a sturdy step stool in my opinion, though. Then again, my son is almost 3 and over 30 pounds so if your child is smaller or if you don't care to use it as a step-stool, then it's great. We mostly used the removable seat and even travelled with it while my son was still training!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect training seat! It has all the qualities we were looking for. It converts to fit a normal toilet. It has rubber grips on the bottom to keep from sliding. And the base can be used as a stool. It's even perfect for travel. I wanted something we could take with us so our daughter doesn't have to use public restrooms until she can use them without touching everything. We can just line the bowl part with a grocery bags and pull the seat down over it. Great quality and functionality!
customer_reviews.author: Kelleo

customer_reviews.title: I thought it was very easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This potty works well for my toddler. We introduced it when he was 18 months and he started using it somewhat regularly around 2 years. I specifically wanted a potty that had multiple uses because I don’t have room in my little bathroom to also store a step stool or extra potty seat. My son has used both the little potty and the insert on the regular toilet, depending on his mood. I thought it was very easy to clean. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for potty training my son
customer_reviews.text: I ended up purchasing two of these, one for upstairs and one for downstairs. It worked great for potty training my son. The seat is soft but durable. It was plenty big enough even for my almost three year old as he phased out of using this and just started using the regular toilet. They held up well enough that I will be able to reuse them to train my youngest.
customer_reviews.author: Tony K. Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Granddaughter really likes this
customer_reviews.text: Well made, just right size. I would buy again. Just starting potty training. I put this in bathroom prior to training so she would get used to it. She definitely does because her seal of her approval is....putting stickers on her favorite things. She just updated to Christmas stickers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great space saving design and works great!!
customer_reviews.text: We're a baby bjorn family, to the extent that when I have to buy a new product I jump to baby bjorn brand because they've been consistently the best (carrier anyone? hands down the best). This toilet trainer may be the only thing I've come across that is better than the baby bjorn equivalent. This is a Great convenient 4-in-1! Great space saving design, and works well. The fact that you can close the cover makes things so much neater looking too. *fyi this is for baby girls. Donno about boys, I've heard toilets need to be built differently to prevent splatter? Can't comment there.
customer_reviews.author: CaliforniaZaineb

customer_reviews.title: perfect for us!
customer_reviews.text: I took a star off because the box wasn't even taped shut when it arrived and I don't appreciate my orders being treated with such little care. However, it still came in great condition. Some reviewers said theirs looked used, but mine was perfectly clean. My daughter loves it. Super easy to take apart, put back together & use. The seat fits perfectly on our toilets with no wiggle room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good pick
customer_reviews.text: I like this seat. My daughter also likes it and thinks it is a toy. The handles seem a little bit flimsy so I don’t know how many kids they will last through, but I like how it converts and also kind of looks like a real potty.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Holley

customer_reviews.title: This is the one!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best little potty you can buy. It closes to be used as a stool. the seat comes off so you can use it on the big toilet. A little Basin pops out and is easy to clean. It's the perfect height. I wish I bought two because you need one everywhere when you're potty training!
customer_reviews.author: Felicia Harrison

customer_reviews.title: It's a potty chair!
customer_reviews.text: works as intended. We've had this potty for a few years now, and it is still usable. My only complaint is that urine gets under the blue cushion, and needs to be disassembled regularly to be cleaned. If it was all one piece for the removable seat portion, it would be easier. There are small crevices that collect the urine, and the seat has yellowed a little over time.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Great starter potty
customer_reviews.text: Great toilet trainer for my daughter and she uses it as a step stool in the kitchen and bathroom. Great you can remove the seat before you empty. Keeps it much cleaner. Daughter really likes using this potty and we transitioned her to pull-ups when she started using the potty.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Great trainer seat. The size of this seat is perfect for my two year old, and she really enjoys sitting on the potty. This is very easy to clean and reassemble, the potty is also sturdy enough for her to stand on when she brushes her teeth. The fact we can remove the seat and place it on a regular sized toilet is great selling point; although we are nowhere close to transitioning to the "big" potty full time it was very easy to travel with only the seat and allow our daughter to continue her potty training while on the road.
customer_reviews.author: JMartin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Potty Chair
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with this child toilet trainer. I looked at many different trainers in stores such as Wal-Mart and Target, but this one seems to have the most features and costs the same or less than those in the department stores. It offers everything all in one chair to train your child, which I love! It is also very easy to clean (almost too easy). It is also quite sturdy. I have used the step-stool feature myself and it could hold my weight. It is definitely worth the buy and the best toilet training chair I have found thus far!
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Zero bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: The blue “cushion” pops out and is impossible to put back in. Also don’t like all the nooks and crannies. Makes it impossible to clean. Would return it if it wouldn’t have been used.
customer_reviews.author: K S

customer_reviews.title: Good investment.
customer_reviews.text: I researched for many weeks before buying this. After reading many reviews from helpful parents about which Toilet Trainer they had chosen I finally ordered this one. So far my 11 month old daughter has only used the seat on the big toilet. It fits well on a standard circular toilet and she fits well on the cushioned seat and doesn't mind hanging out there for a while as we introduce her to potty training. It rinses easily but I could see how the shape of the guard in the front might present cleaning problems for parents with little boys. Overall I am very pleased with the product and appreciate its' versatility.
customer_reviews.author: auntyshoes

customer_reviews.title: It's a great potty chair!
customer_reviews.text: It's a great potty chair! We had a fancy singing one, then all he wanted to do was play with it (turning around, flushing etc) so we bought just a better than basic potty chair. He gets his business done. He empties it himself (with a little rinsing help) then he shuts it & moves it to stand on for hand washing at the sink. When he get a bit more confident we will use just the insert on the toilet. Has a handle so it can be transported easily, good to go to grandmas house. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Liesetta

customer_reviews.title: The product works well and the comfort seems to be ...
customer_reviews.text: The product works well and the comfort seems to be approve by the little one. One issue, the glue connecting the seat cushion to the layer under it, as not acted appropriately as an adhesive. While this is a defect, it didn't really impact the function of the overall product. It does create an extra "layer" or plastic to remove when you clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Ballard

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Potty for the Win
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one early this year and finally my daughter has been using it. So far its easy to clean, convertible seat that sits on the potty or can go on top of a regular toilet seat with no fuss. The handles make it easy to move around without a mess. Even my daughter is able to pick it up without any issues. Would highly recommend for purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Unsatisfactory
customer_reviews.text: When this package arrived and was opened it looked used. As soon as I opened the box the item was just in the box no plastic wrapping, no instructions, or other directions, and smelled like urine. Also, along the side of the potty there were old drip marks. Besides the fact that I had been obviously sent a used potty the product seem cheap and not very durable. Sent the item back and will continue looking for another option.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Works well but handles on seat don't fold for storage. SAVE BOX
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I would be the parent who buys one of these to keep in the living room, but his seat works well. The blue does stain from kid foods like pasta sauce and I wish the handles on the seat folded to make it easier to store so DO SAVE THE BOX! The seat part worked well for DISNEY WORLD. I didn't plan on bring the top but our travel fold up seat didn't end up working for our son. Although it was a pain to drag along it kept us from having to change wet pants.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Van Ston

customer_reviews.title: Love this, wish it had a one piece seat though
customer_reviews.text: I really love this potty seat, since it can be many things all in one: potty, stool, travel lid for adult toilet, portable for when my son needs it at grandma's etc. My son loves this potty and loves that it has a lid so he can shut it all by himself when he's done. The only con I have and why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5, is because I wish the blue plastic part of potty was one piece with the seat instead of being removable. With a boy, it's very easy to have to get pee in between those layers and need a cleaning. It just makes it inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: M. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Just about perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to pick up a potty in order to have an option for my LO when traveling. A friend told me to keep it in the car and you never have to find a bathroom. Great idea! The only trouble I saw with this idea was having to clean up the mess while out and about. That's the main reason I like this potty. You can place a diaper in it and the seat will hold it securely in place. No mess to clean up! It also serves as a step stool and this has come in handy ( we use it at home when not traveling). LO seems to really like it too.
customer_reviews.author: Red Rocks

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: It's Great! Toddler, Mom and Dad love it, the material, the weight, the assembly, the 4 in 1, everything is well made and design, maybe an improve will be to make it lighter, but it's just fine as it is now, highly recommended (when i bought it was 26, so i guess it was a good buy)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this is such a great potty for her
customer_reviews.text: My toddler is 2, and we arebad potty training, this is such a great potty for her. She loves using "mommys potty" so , she grabs her seat puts it on the big potty, steps up, and does her business. She feels so so proud of herself after and I am so proud of her. Really gives kids their "own". My tot is a very independent little person.
customer_reviews.author: Doug coletti

customer_reviews.title: Not a good potty for boy
customer_reviews.text: The padding on the seat was cheap. I have a little boy. When he goes to potty the pee would go everywhere. The pee also leek through between the seat. But I like the idea of more then one use of the potty.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia

customer_reviews.title: Has worked great for us
customer_reviews.text: I love how versatile this potty is. My daughter has the choice to use the little potty or she can put the seat insert on the toilet, close the lid, and use it as a stool to get up to the toilet. We've had this for over 18 months and it's held up well, although we only started using it regularly in the last few months. My daughter prefers using the toilet and seat insert so I don't have feedback on ease of cleaning the potty bucket (though it does come out easily).
customer_reviews.author: kljm

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for every new potty-goer
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for every new potty-goer!! The parts of this potty have been carefully designed. The seat fits perfectly and is easily removed and replaced without struggling to re-align. The bowl is also very easy to lift out and doesn't catch or stick. Our little one can easily remove and replace it to empty into the toilet herself!! The lid, when up, leans back at a perfect angle so as to not fall back onto child when using, and closes snugly and doubles as a stool to reach the sink for washing hands or brushing teeth. The way this product is built has added to our little one's success and pride at accomplishing these tasks herself. I would recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I never thought I could love a potty seat
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing! The first seat we tried was a hard plastic one, and my son would sit for a few minutes, then say 'mommy, booty hurt.' This one has never caused a problem. We have no problem with urine spraying out, and have used the top part on the toilet as well. If only it could fold up and go in my diaper bag, I would never need anything else! We did get the flip-down seat for our toilet, but my son prefers this one. He's only just turned two, so I'm sure in time he'll graduate to the bigger one:
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Stoker

customer_reviews.title: Favorite potty chair
customer_reviews.text: This is a firm seat that doesn't slide around while the child is trying to sit. It cleans easily (unless the urine gets under the blue part of the seat, but that's still not too difficult to remove and clean). It is a great height for a training toddler.
customer_reviews.author: RCalps

customer_reviews.title: Love, even for just the toilet insert
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 1 yr old daughter who is doing early potty learning. I've tried several seats that go on the toilet but this one is by far the most secure. (Elongated seat) I haven't even used the potty chair part because she prefers the toilet, and it's way easier than cleaning a potty! I think I'll probably use the chair as a step stool as suggested but it's not quite as sturdy as I had hoped. It's pricy for just a toilet insert, but I'm getting a second one if that tells you anything!
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Bummer

customer_reviews.title: This is the best potty we've tried so far
customer_reviews.text: This is the best potty we've tried so far! Our two year old doesn't like to sit on any other toddler potty. The seat is comfy and the handles help him get up from it. The seat comes off and you can put it on an adult toilet and use the rest of the potty for a foot stool. I would definitely recommend this potty, it's made potty training much easier for us and our son!
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Inventors put some thought into this one.
customer_reviews.text: I bought both this potty and the Bjorn and I like the Primo much more. I first bought the Bjorn because of the higher reviews, but I personally didn't like the smaller seat size and it was cumbersome to travel with. It also did not have a way to transition from training potty to the adult size toilet. The Primo does this as it's description. I agree with some reviews that the splash guard is low, but it taught my son to lean forward so no sprinkling occurs. This lesson is invaluable since the pre-school toilets don't have splash guards. The fact that it's a step stool too makes it so much more worth it.
customer_reviews.author: SommMom

customer_reviews.title: Good training potty
customer_reviews.text: This potty is easy to clean (it has a removable pan), the fact the seat comes out means that you can put it in the regular toilet, having the lid makes it more like the real thing for kids who are heavy on mimicking behavior. Well built, and the ability to use it as a step-stool will likely be helpful when our daughter is a bit bigger. I've been really happy with how hassle-free using this potty has been.
customer_reviews.author: C. Slocum

customer_reviews.title: Great Potty for Boys and Girls
customer_reviews.text: Love this Potty. Unlike other customers I think it's a great seat for both boys and girls. The splash guard does what it's suppose to even when my little one, who is 22 months likes to lean back and watch himself potty. Very sturdy but not heavy and the parts a extremely easy to clean. The only drawback for me is it's a little too big to carry it as a whole ensemble being he refuses to sit on the big potty when we go visit relatives. But when he's ready the seat can fit most standard toilets so there is that.
customer_reviews.author: Chance2013

customer_reviews.title: Good and portable
customer_reviews.text: Good and portable potty trainer for at home. It's a little big for travel, unless of course you're just taking the top seat with you and placing that on a regular toilet. Overall my kid likes it better than climbing up a regular toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Zom

customer_reviews.title: Thank you for great product (toilet trainer) for my 2
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for great product (toilet trainer) for my 2,5 y.o grandson. Excellent quality and easy to use for kids, soft seat as described and very convenient for traveling as well. I recommend to buy it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Leonid Yakobson

customer_reviews.title: Most useful and best potty for my son
customer_reviews.text: I tried three different potties for my son before ordering this one. This one is the only one my son will use. The fact that the seat removes and can be placed on a full-size potty makes this one even more appealing because it'll be useful longer. It also works well as a seat for me (with the lid closed, of course) when giving my son a bath and a step for him to reach the sink to wash his hands.
customer_reviews.author: DingoT12

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal for short kids
customer_reviews.text: Overall great potty. I love the removable seat. It is a little too tall for my 1.5 yr old daughter to get on with out help.
customer_reviews.author: Emma Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Lower splashguard, slightly softer seat, happier baby
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves this potty way more than the other one - I think this seat is just a tad softer. And the splash guard in the front is lower than the summer infant one, which makes it easier for the little one to sit down comfortably. Also this one is easier to carry around since the lid/seat back folds down. Also she doesn't try to take this one apart all the time, possibly because she hasn't figured it out or it's not as obvious.
customer_reviews.author: Lost in FreeFall

customer_reviews.title: We LOVE this toilet seat
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this toilet seat! We love the option of moving around the seat, putting the kid converter on the big toilet, or using this as a stool to reach the sink. It's easy enough to use that our daughter can take the top off and dump the contents in the big toilet by herself (with only minor spillage). Whenever I hear people are potty training I always recommend this because it works great and is really affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: Great for Potty Training
customer_reviews.text: My 30lb. 2 1/2 year old uses this product easily and well. She used the handles on the potty when she was potty training and the transition to the toilet was easy as the potty turned into a step up stool, and the toilet seat fit perfectly into ours, both with their own set of handles. Rinses out super easy, even if you let the pee accidently dry. Not the prettiest, but the most functional, comfortable, and decently priced.
customer_reviews.author: MyDomoLife

customer_reviews.title: The potty itself is lightweight and great for the early stages of potty training
customer_reviews.text: We used this to potty train my 19 month old and still continue to use the insert 6 months later. The potty itself is lightweight and great for the early stages of potty training. Once he got the hang of it we went to insert-only on the adult toilet and he has used it ever since. My only complaints would be the blue rubber part of the insert detaches from its base very easily and can slide around when he first sits down. Overall I would recommend this product to anyone looking for a reasonably priced but effective potty training tool.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: It's alright. We mostly just use the detachable seat.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter doesn't like using the potty as a standalone thing, so we've just been using the detachable seat on the toilet (still in the very early stages). The bump in the middle front isn't huge, though I get the impression she'd prefer not to have it there so she could put her legs closer together. It also leaves red marks on her bottom and legs because of how the blue part of the seat is curved. It's not a smooth curve, but rather has a small lip curving up around the center, which causes undue pressure. If I had to choose again, I'd probably just buy a stool and a soft seat to go on the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Rynne

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Little Toilet
customer_reviews.text: I love the design of this toilet! It's perfect. It seems very well constructed and durable. The seat is well shaped and seems comfortable. The handles on the side make it easy for my daughter to balance when getting up and down. I love that you can close the seat and use it as a step stool when they wash their hands. My daughter loves it so much, she wants to sit on it all the time, whether or not she actually has to go to the bathroom. I would recommend this toilet to anyone potty training their kid!
customer_reviews.author: Harperina

customer_reviews.title: However it has a lot of pieces that come apart which I find annoying while cleaning it
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it serves it's purpose. However it has a lot of pieces that come apart which I find annoying while cleaning it, so I wish that I had gotten something simpler. It also slips around pretty easily on our tiled floor, making me nervous especially when she is using it as a stool to reach the sink.
customer_reviews.author: B. A. Kermath

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Hard to clean, boy pee often goes onto seat and then gets between blue rubber and white frame, messy. Recommend highly sloped seat like the prince lionheart ones for a boy.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: So far it seems like it will work
customer_reviews.text: So far it seems like it will work. No back support on it what-so-ever, and the seat had to be put together because the rubber seat part was not put on the frame that well. Nothing super glue couldn't fix. The splash guard isn't curved back on the inside, which just makes it a straight wall, which means that the pee splashes everywhere instead of being directed downward.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Kilkka

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I have two toilet trainers - I bought this one after another one purchased. I love this one so much more for my little girl who is starting to potty-train. She picks this one over the other every time. The option to move the soft seat portion to the adult toilet will be fantastic, and the lid is even better. She likes to close it the way she sees the adult toilet lid closed, and she also uses it as a stepping stool.
customer_reviews.author: MMH

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy Grandmother!
customer_reviews.text: I am a grandmother and don’t like to have a lot of potty stuff in my small bathroom. This is a great way to get a stool for washing hands after and nice size potty for my bathroom. The seat is softened for the long time sitting it might have to take.....very Happy with this potty thanks...
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Been a solid addition to the toddy training tool set. The built in potty is a good starting point. Only used it for the first few times, then it was on to the seat insert. It was useful in the early stages on the big potty. The step stool is the most useful long term though. She will be using it for quite a while. It makes her (almost) independent with her potty time. It's stood up to a bouncing climbing girl so far, seems pretty solid.
customer_reviews.author: San Diego Dad

customer_reviews.title: The pieces don't fit together super easily so the blue part flops off frequently
customer_reviews.text: The pieces don't fit together super easily so the blue part flops off frequently, especially with the frequency that you are emptying it out. Its a nice size, but too many pieces also makes it a pain to clean. Nice sturdy little stool as far as that part goes.
customer_reviews.author: Lelightning

customer_reviews.title: Best potty seat purchase
customer_reviews.text: Best potty seat purchase! No gimmick, no annoying sound/song, no blinking lights. The potty seat is soft and comfy. My son now uses the potty seat on regular toilet and use the base as a stool. The potty seat fits nicely into the oval toilet seat.
customer_reviews.author: L. Purawinata

customer_reviews.title: Not for a Boy
customer_reviews.text: The front part is not shaped right to catch my 2 year old son's potty. It shoots either over or next to the part that comes up in the front. This potty chair was definitely not designed for a boy unless he takes his pants off all the way and leans forward while sitting perfectly square on it.
customer_reviews.author: Kim L

customer_reviews.title: Functional Potty for the Littles Ones
customer_reviews.text: The best potty ever. Seat fits neatly on our toilets and the kids love the soft blue colour (now that's an incentive to want to us it) and easy to use comfortable seat. Travel wise, the seat is easy and light to carry and have followed us in our relocation from Singapore to California. The step is a good height for the little ones and easy for the older one to carry to the sink for step up to wash her hands. It's truly a functional potty.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Wong

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The seat is soft and apparently comfortable. My 2 year old daughter prefers this over a harder potty that we have on a different floor. The detachable seat gives her the flexibility to go on the "little potty" or "Mamma's potty." The stickers were a nice bonus to help encourage use. I'd like the potty to be a little taller/higher so that it is easier to reach the sink when used as a stepstool. I have this complaint with both potties we own, so I suspect there's some safety issue with raising the height too much (or the issue could be with my sink's height/depth).
customer_reviews.author: Frank Garriel

customer_reviews.title: Great potty training tool
customer_reviews.text: What I love about this potty training set is that the seat is softer then the other sets we have had. It’s great that you can transition from the set to the toilet with this seat. My little boy will be comfortable making that transition!
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Wagahoff

customer_reviews.title: not easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I like that it's a stool and that it the lid goes down flat. The blue "cushion" is a good idea in theory but it is detachable from the white handle piece and pee gets under the blue cushion. The tabs to put the blue cushion back into the white base are soft plastic and curl or don't fit back into the white handle base very easily. In short, It's not an easy item to clean and the blue cushion is cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: Julie (Radke) Rokser

customer_reviews.title: Perfect potty!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson (aged 3) would not use a different potty I had bought. But he loves this one. It will grow with him. At the moment he uses the potty and the stool - to wash his hands. I am very pleased with this product - it is sturdy and well made. I am sure it will last through my granddaughter's potty training too!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Very useful design.
customer_reviews.text: Baby uses it, he likes to sit on it, so it must be comfortabl!
customer_reviews.author: J Foster

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: We returned ours. It's way too cumbersome and emptying it is a pain since you have to remove the seat to get to the pot. I really liked the one-handed emptying of the BabyBjorn or Summer Infant potties that are 1/2 - 1/3 the price. There's also no way this is sturdy enough to be a step stool.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: The product details kind of says it all. I love that you can put the seat on the real toilet so you don't have to empty the pot. I use it both ways and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Phil&Becky

customer_reviews.title: Well designed & made
customer_reviews.text: Love the design. Bought months before ready to use it. Was using as step for child to reach sink to was hands. Just starting to use in its entirety. The seat is soft enough to sit for a period of time and durable. Well designed and made!
customer_reviews.author: TT156

customer_reviews.title: Ouch
customer_reviews.text: This potty started out great. We started using it and next thing we know our 3 year old developed a rash ring around her rear. Either the paint or the plastic material itself caused her rash to break out. We have stopped using it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product!
customer_reviews.text: After buying several other potties, we finally found one that is versatile, practical, easy to clean and best of all...one my daughter loves! She kept saying "comfy!" when she sat on it. She loves sitting on it, which makes potty training easy! Some times she will just go over and sit on it because she loves it so much. All the different things it does makes it even better! It is on the bigger side, but it isn't enough to make it inconvenient. I recommended it to all my other friends who are also potty training!
customer_reviews.author: summerh

customer_reviews.title: Good overall
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this for roughly over 1 month. I really enjoy how it can be taken apart for cleaning. My son, 2 yrs old, loves using it as a step stool, and I have to admit it is a really useful feature. Overall its is great. My only critique is that the seat is not soft as in padded. It is soft in texture. The descriptions felt a little misleading to me. The seat is more like a soft feeling thick liner. I would definitely buy this product again and I am considering getting one for the grandparents house.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus S.

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought this first. Grandson is big ...
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had bought this first. Grandson is big and this has a larger seat area for him. Also doesn't move when on the big toilet as it has 4 rubber pads that keep it from moving!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Not too small Sturdy Closing lid acts as a stool so they can stand on it to reach the sink Blue part inside is rubber so it's softer than other potties Cons: The lid doesn't latch closed, or at least mine doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: A good size for toddlers in training
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these: one in each bathroom. My 2 yr old son is very comfortable sitting on them (while sometimes reading a book) and leaving after he's done: no stepping down: no accidental toilet dives into water from an adult sized toilet booster seat. Plus, the seat on this can be placed on a normal flushing toilet once they become larger. Also serves as a useful backup when traveling and there are no rest stops nearby. Cleaning of these toilets is easy and they reassemble in seconds. I'm happy with this baby porta/training potty.
customer_reviews.author: EF

customer_reviews.title: After 5 we found the ONE
customer_reviews.text: This was by far the BEST potty seat we purchased... and we purchased 5! This was comfy. Big enough for a toddler is tall and easy to clean. The removable seat is ok. It fits most toilets. We used it for begining potty training and have moved on to a step stool and Lionheart Weepod. But this was a great way to start
customer_reviews.author: ally

customer_reviews.title: Used potty? Should've been brand new.
customer_reviews.text: The potty inner cup looked used. Disgusting!!! It was supposed to be brand new. I wont be buying a potty online. I will be cautious of the kind of baby stuff i buy online from now on. Completely unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: AVicked123

customer_reviews.title: GREAT, GREAT toilet training seat!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toilet training seat as it also has the removable seat which easily comes off and sits securely on the toilet with great handles for the child to hold on to help them feel secure. The stool when closed is great to help them get on the toilet once the detachable seat is in place but also for reaching sink for hand washing afterwards. Did alot of looking and by far best at great price!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne L. Vanderberg

customer_reviews.title: Eh nothing to see here
customer_reviews.text: It's nice and all but the blue part comes off all the time, also the pee guard is kinda small so we have had a few accidents due to "coverage" issues
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good, comfortable potty
customer_reviews.text: This is a good, inexpensive potty. The design is sturdy and generously sized. If you have a larger or older child who is still using the potty, this potty will probably work for you. The seat has a rubber-type covering that makes it somewhat softer than just plastic, and the design is far more ergonomic and comfortable than other potty seats. We use it as a travel potty too--just keep it in the trunk.
customer_reviews.author: Irene

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed seat hard to clean and wiggly under baby booties
customer_reviews.text: The rubber/silicon seat is attached to the plastic piece with handles with very small tabs that come loose with every use. This also creates a lot of little crannies that are hard to clean. If the seat were a solid piece this would be a great little potty, but as is it's a cleaning nightmare and unsturdy under wiggly booties.
customer_reviews.author: C. Opalak

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a potty training starter kit for my little one when she was one and half year old. She is two and half now and still loves it. Worth the money. So comfortable that we take this set for our travel times too. The stool also stands firm to my kids weight. Will recommend this product for people who want to buy removable potty seat with stool for lesser the money.
customer_reviews.author: prem

customer_reviews.title: great potty
customer_reviews.text: We love this potty. I wanted a basic potty. I don't want it to sing, dance, play music or light up. I love that it has the handles on the side for him to hold on to. It can also be used as a step still so when he started using the blue part on the regular toilet, he can use the other party as a still to wash his hands. I love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: jess

customer_reviews.title: This is the one you want!
customer_reviews.text: This potty made a frustrating potty training experience turn around within 10 minutes! So great and love the versatility and it's pretty easy to clean too. My daughter had been rebelling a bit after having made progress, so when this arrived and I told her it was her own special potty (rather than the seat that sits on a regular potty) she was super excited and used it immediately! It's been an easy road ever since and she no longer wears diapers unless she is sleeping! woohoo!
customer_reviews.author: Tov

customer_reviews.title: Great Potty!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great potty! We really like how big it is and it must be comfortable too. Our daughter sets up shop and reads on there. We haven't used it as a step or used the seat by itself. It's easy to clean and seems to be deep enough.
customer_reviews.author: K. S. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Not toddler-parent friendly: too many pieces that get dirty, too hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: This toilet seat has too many pieces that make it really easy to get dirty and really hard to clean. In particular, the seat adapter for a big toilet has a plastic cushion on top of a harder surface and my toddler's pee gets between those two all the time. Even though it is easy to transport (which makes for a good "on the go" potty), it is just too cumbersome for the needs of a toddler in training
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly just a little cheap...
customer_reviews.text: I really like this potty and I'm glad we purchased it. The seat seems to be comfortable and the handles are nice to have. I love that the seat can be put on a regular toilet. The one thing that I don't like is the fact that it seems to be a bit cheap in the way it is put together. the blue seat part comes apart from the white frame that it is in fairly easily. Hasn't been an issue yet at all but I just don't like it. I do like the fact that it can be a stool as well. All around, I like this potty a lot. Just seems to be cheaply put together.
customer_reviews.author: Justine N. Trego

product_meta.title: Primo 4-In-1 Soft Seat Toilet Trainer and Step Stool White with Pastel Blue Seat
product_meta.description:
Color:BluePRIMO's 4 In 1 Soft Seat Toilet Trainer/Step Stool is a complete graduated 4 stage toilet training system. It follows your child through all of the stages of toilet training 1) beginning as a stand alone potty with an extra large easy to clean pot 2) graduating to the adult toilet with the PRIMO Soft Seat Reducer and step stool 3) using the step stool to reach the bathroom sink to clean hands 4) traveling with the PRIMO Soft Seat Reducer to continue and reinforce toilet training skills learned at home. The unique molded design of the PRIMO Soft Seat Reducer will not tear or rip and is easy to clean unlike many of the vinyl cushioned soft seats on the market today. Handles are integrated into the PRIMO Soft Seat Reducer to provide extra security and stability to the child. The PRIMO Soft Seat Reducer can be used on either a round or elongated adult toilet seat. The base of PRIMO's 4 In 1 Soft Seat Toilet Trainer/Step Stool is extra wide for added stability. It has handles that are also integrated into the Primo Soft Seat Reducer that allow the unit to be moved easily without the components coming apart. The base doubles as a step stool to allow your child to reach the sink to wash their hands and face for personal hygiene. The base supports a child's weight up to 45 pounds. Included are bonuses to aide and complete the toilet training experience. Toilet Training Tips for parents, a fun set of reward stickers to encourage your child to use the toilet trainer, and discount coupons for training pants to help parents economize on the toilet training experience.

MANUFACTURER'S NOTICE
The seat cover for the 4-In-1 Potty is not made of rubber. The blue seat is made from a phthalate free, lead free, non-toxic, plastic vinyl. PRIMO has no knowledge of any allergic reactions or rashes from the 4-In-1 Potty seat.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
PRIMO's 4-In-1 Soft Seat Toilet Trainer/Step Stool is a complete graduated 4 stage toilet training system! It follows your child through all of the stages of toilet training 1) beginning as a stand-alone potty with an extra large easy to clean pot 2) graduating to the adult toilet with the PRIMO Soft Seat Reducer and step stool 3) using the step stool to reach the bathroom sink to clean hands 4) traveling with the PRIMO Soft Seat Reducer to continue and reinforce toilet training skills learned at home. The unique molded design of the PRIMO Soft Seat Reducer will not tear or rip and is easy to clean - unlike many of the vinyl cushioned soft seats on the market today. Handles are integrated into the PRIMO Soft Seat Reducer to provide extra security and stability to the child. The PRIMO Soft Seat Reducer can be used on either a round or elongated adult toilet seat. The base of PRIMO's 4-In-1 Soft Seat Toilet Trainer/Step Stool is extra wide for added stability. It has handles that are also integrated into the Primo Soft Seat Reducer that allow the unit to be moved easily without the components coming apart. The base doubles as a step stool to allow your child to reach the sink to wash their hands and face for personal hygiene. The base supports a child's weight up to 45 pounds. Included are bonuses to aide and complete the toilet training experience. Toilet Training Tips for parents, a fun set of reward stickers to encourage your child to use the toilet trainer, and discount coupons for training pants to help parents economize on the toilet training experience.

See more
feature_bullets: Complete graduated 4 stage toilet training system. Includes stand alone potty, soft toilet seat reducer and step stool
Unique molded design of the PRIMO Soft Seat Reducer will not tear or rip and is easy to clean
Handles are integrated into the PRIMO Soft Seat Reducer to provide extra security and stability to the child
Includes toilet training tips, reward stickers and discount coupons for training pants

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars693 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
